description: VirtualNode is the Schema for the virtualnodes API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: VirtualNodeSpec defines the desired state of VirtualNode refers to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/app-mesh/latest/APIReference/API_VirtualNodeSpec.html

awsName.description: AWSName is the AppMesh VirtualNode object's name. If unspecified or empty, it defaults to be "${name}_${namespace}" of k8s VirtualNode

backendDefaults.description: A reference to an object that represents the defaults for backends.

clientPolicy.description: A reference to an object that represents a client policy.

tls.description: A reference to an object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) client policy.

certificate.description: A reference to an object that represents TLS certificate.

file.description: An object that represents a TLS cert via a local file

certificateChain.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

privateKey.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: An object that represents a TLS cert via SDS entry

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate issued via SDS cluster

enforce.description: Whether the policy is enforced. If unspecified, default settings from AWS API will be applied. Refer to AWS Docs for default settings.

ports.description: The range of ports that the policy is enforced for.

validation.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context.

trust.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context trust

acm.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certicate Manager (ACM) certificate.

certificateAuthorityARNs.description: One or more ACM Amazon Resource Name (ARN)s.

file.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a local file.

certificateChain.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a SDS.

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate obtained via SDS

backendGroups.description: BackendGroups that define a set of backends the virtual node is expected to send outbound traffic to.

items.description: BackendGroupReference holds a reference to BackendGroup.appmesh.k8s.aws

name.description: Name is the name of BackendGroup CR

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of BackendGroup CR. If unspecified, defaults to the referencing object's namespace

backends.description: The backends that the virtual node is expected to send outbound traffic to.

virtualService.description: Specifies a virtual service to use as a backend for a virtual node.

clientPolicy.description: A reference to an object that represents the client policy for a backend.

tls.description: A reference to an object that represents a Transport Layer Security (TLS) client policy.

certificate.description: A reference to an object that represents TLS certificate.

file.description: An object that represents a TLS cert via a local file

certificateChain.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

privateKey.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: An object that represents a TLS cert via SDS entry

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate issued via SDS cluster

enforce.description: Whether the policy is enforced. If unspecified, default settings from AWS API will be applied. Refer to AWS Docs for default settings.

ports.description: The range of ports that the policy is enforced for.

validation.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context.

trust.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context trust

acm.description: A reference to an object that represents a TLS validation context trust for an AWS Certicate Manager (ACM) certificate.

certificateAuthorityARNs.description: One or more ACM Amazon Resource Name (ARN)s.

file.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a local file.

certificateChain.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a SDS.

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate obtained via SDS

virtualServiceARN.description: Amazon Resource Name to AppMesh VirtualService object that is acting as a virtual node backend. Exactly one of 'virtualServiceRef' or 'virtualServiceARN' must be specified.

virtualServiceRef.description: Reference to Kubernetes VirtualService CR in cluster that is acting as a virtual node backend. Exactly one of 'virtualServiceRef' or 'virtualServiceARN' must be specified.

name.description: Name is the name of VirtualService CR

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of VirtualService CR. If unspecified, defaults to the referencing object's namespace

listeners.description: The listener that the virtual node is expected to receive inbound traffic from

connectionPool.description: The connection pool settings for the listener

grpc.description: Specifies grpc connection pool settings for the virtual node listener

maxRequests.description: Represents the maximum number of inflight requests that an envoy can concurrently support across all the hosts in the upstream cluster

http.description: Specifies http connection pool settings for the virtual node listener

maxConnections.description: Represents the maximum number of outbound TCP connections the envoy can establish concurrently with all the hosts in the upstream cluster.

maxPendingRequests.description: Represents the number of overflowing requests after max_connections that an envoy will queue to an upstream cluster.

http2.description: Specifies http2 connection pool settings for the virtual node listener

maxRequests.description: Represents the maximum number of inflight requests that an envoy can concurrently support across all the hosts in the upstream cluster

tcp.description: Specifies tcp connection pool settings for the virtual node listener

maxConnections.description: Represents the maximum number of outbound TCP connections the envoy can establish concurrently with all the hosts in the upstream cluster.

healthCheck.description: The health check information for the listener.

healthyThreshold.description: The number of consecutive successful health checks that must occur before declaring listener healthy.

intervalMillis.description: The time period in milliseconds between each health check execution.

path.description: The destination path for the health check request. This value is only used if the specified protocol is http or http2. For any other protocol, this value is ignored.

port.description: The destination port for the health check request.

protocol.description: The protocol for the health check request

timeoutMillis.description: The amount of time to wait when receiving a response from the health check, in milliseconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: The number of consecutive failed health checks that must occur before declaring a virtual node unhealthy.

outlierDetection.description: The outlier detection for the listener

baseEjectionDuration.description: The base time that a host is ejected for. The real time is equal to the base time multiplied by the number of times the host has been ejected

interval.description: The time interval between ejection analysis sweeps. This can result in both new ejections as well as hosts being returned to service

maxEjectionPercent.description: The threshold for the max percentage of outlier hosts that can be ejected from the load balancing set. maxEjectionPercent=100 means outlier detection can potentially eject all of the hosts from the upstream service if they are all considered outliers, leaving the load balancing set with zero hosts

maxServerErrors.description: The threshold for the number of server errors returned by a given host during an outlier detection interval. If the server error count meets/exceeds this threshold the host is ejected. A server error is defined as any HTTP 5xx response (or the equivalent for gRPC and TCP connections)

portMapping.description: The port mapping information for the listener.

port.description: The port used for the port mapping.

protocol.description: The protocol used for the port mapping.

timeout.description: A reference to an object that represents

grpc.description: Specifies grpc timeout information for the virtual node.

idle.description: An object that represents idle timeout duration.

perRequest.description: An object that represents per request timeout duration.

http.description: Specifies http timeout information for the virtual node.

idle.description: An object that represents idle timeout duration.

perRequest.description: An object that represents per request timeout duration.

http2.description: Specifies http2 information for the virtual node.

idle.description: An object that represents idle timeout duration.

perRequest.description: An object that represents per request timeout duration.

tcp.description: Specifies tcp timeout information for the virtual node.

idle.description: An object that represents idle timeout duration.

tls.description: A reference to an object that represents the Transport Layer Security (TLS) properties for a listener.

certificate.description: A reference to an object that represents a listener's TLS certificate.

acm.description: A reference to an object that represents an AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) certificate.

certificateARN.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the certificate.

file.description: A reference to an object that represents a local file certificate.

certificateChain.description: The certificate chain for the certificate.

privateKey.description: The private key for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: A reference to an object that represents an SDS certificate.

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate issued via SDS cluster

validation.description: A reference to an object that represents an SDS Trust Domain

file.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for a local file.

certificateChain.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate stored on the file system of the virtual node that the proxy is running on.

sds.description: An object that represents a TLS validation context trust for an SDS server

secretName.description: The certificate trust chain for a certificate obtained via SDS

logging.description: The inbound and outbound access logging information for the virtual node.

accessLog.description: The access log configuration for a virtual node.

file.description: The file object to send virtual node access logs to.

json.description: Output specified fields as a JSON object

key.description: The name of the field in the JSON object

path.description: The file path to write access logs to.

meshRef.description:
A reference to k8s Mesh CR that this VirtualNode belongs to. The admission controller populates it using Meshes's selector, and prevents users from setting this field. 
 Populated by the system. Read-only.

name.description: Name is the name of Mesh CR

uid.description: UID is the UID of Mesh CR

podSelector.description: PodSelector selects Pods using labels to designate VirtualNode membership. This field follows standard label selector semantics: 	if present but empty, it selects all pods within namespace. 	if absent, it selects no pod.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

serviceDiscovery.description: The service discovery information for the virtual node. Optional if there is no inbound traffic(no listeners). Mandatory if a listener is specified.

awsCloudMap.description: Specifies any AWS Cloud Map information for the virtual node.

attributes.description: A string map that contains attributes with values that you can use to filter instances by any custom attribute that you specified when you registered the instance

key.description: The name of an AWS Cloud Map service instance attribute key.

value.description: The value of an AWS Cloud Map service instance attribute key.

namespaceName.description: The name of the AWS Cloud Map namespace to use.

serviceName.description: The name of the AWS Cloud Map service to use.

dns.description: Specifies the DNS information for the virtual node.

hostname.description: Specifies the DNS service discovery hostname for the virtual node.

responseType.description: Choose between ENDPOINTS (strict DNS) and LOADBALANCER (logical DNS) mode in Envoy sidecar

status.description: VirtualNodeStatus defines the observed state of VirtualNode

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

observedGeneration.description: The generation observed by the VirtualNode controller.

virtualNodeARN.description: VirtualNodeARN is the AppMesh VirtualNode object's Amazon Resource Name
